Creating a Project

Now, we will create a project. Eclipse organizes all your Java classes into independent projects. You will normally create a new project for each lab and each assignment; you can also create additional projects for experimentation.

To create your project:

  1. Go to File -> New -> Java Project
  2. Enter "project1" as the name of the project. Hit Finish. The project should appear in Eclipse's Package Explorer (normally on the left side of the screen). Expand it and confirm that you see a src folder.

Java allows us to further organize code into packages:

  1. Right-click on src in your new project, select New, and choose Package.
  2. Name the new package "lab1". In order for us to be able to find your work, make sure you get the spelling and case correct.
